DOC.brief_title: Observational Study of Iron Metabolism in Anemia in ICU and Post-Operative Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Anemia in intensive care and post-operative patients is due to both blood loss (leading to iron loss) and inflammation. The latter is known to interfere with iron metabolism, inducing iron storage instead of using it for hemoglobin synthesis. The discover of a new regulatory hormone of iron metabolism, hepcidin, may help us to better understand the link between inflammation and iron functional deficit. The aim of our study is to observe the variation of usual iron metabolism biological markers and of hepcidin, in order to define the better marker of iron loss in these clinical situations.
DOC.criteria: Anemia (haemoglobin < 10 g/dL) Hospitalization in ICU for an expected duration of 7 days or more Or, day one post cardiac surgery Chronic anemia (Hb < 9 g/dL for more than one month before hospitalization) Iron metabolism disease
